w="506.3157958984375">Player's inventory is priority with payouts, so whenever you are requested to pay, your inventory will be checked first for emeralds.
If this does not succeed, next step will check if there's emeralds on your storage (which can be filled with civilisation table).</comment><value name="amount"><block type="variables_get_number"><mutation xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" is_player_var="true" has_entity="true"></mutation><field name="VAR">global:monthly_cost</field><value name="entity"><block troops!</field></block></value><value name="entity"><block type="entity_from_deps"></block></value><value name="actbar"><block type="logic_boolean"><field is_player_var="true" has_entity="true"></mutation><field name="VAR">global:civilisation_table_storage</field><value name="entity"><block type="entity_from_deps"></block></value></block></value></block></value><value name="B"><block type="variables_get_number"><mutation xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" is_player_var="true" has_entity="true"></mutation><field name="VAR">global:monthly_cost</field><value name="entity"><block type="entity_from_deps"></block></value></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO1"><block type="entity_remove_item"><comment pinned="false" h="191.57891845703125" w="403.15789794921875">This checks if player has enough stored money to pay the monthly cost. Next, it removes all money from inventory (because they are not enough) and adds to storage, because this way we can easily pay the cost without hurting us with too much procedure blocks.
 
If player's inventory is priority anyway, and emeralds in inventory are not enough, it is quite logical that they will be all gone after this, after all.</comment><value name="amount"><block
